title: About Ganesh Vadlamuri
excerpt: Senior Software Engineer focused on fraud detection, cloud modernization, and secure systems. Previously at Texas State, AWS, KSR Marine Exports, and GNR Health Care.
content:
## Brief Summary

I build reliable, secure software and data systems with a strong focus on cloud modernization, observability, and automation. I currently work on fraud detection at Wells Fargo, modernizing platforms and services for OpenShift and GCP.

### Highlights
- Modernized microservices: Java 11 to 17, Spring Boot 3.x; PCF to OpenShift migration, containerization best practices.
- Strengthened security: addressed critical vulnerabilities; improved CI/CD (Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker); BDD with Cucumber/Gherkin.
- Event-driven systems: Kafka + MongoDB/OracleDB; proactive observability with Splunk dashboards/alerts.
- GenAI PoC to explore anomaly detection and fraud analytics.

### Prior Experience
- Texas State University: services and UIs (Java/Spring Boot, Angular/React); AWS (EC2, RDS, S3), Terraform; Docker/Kubernetes; analytics and dashboards (Tableau/Power BI).
- AWS (Cloud Engineer): secure, scalable AWS solutions; automation with Python, AWS CLI, Terraform.
- KSR Marine Exports: REST APIs, ETL (AWS Glue/Azure Data Factory), dashboards, CI/CD with Jenkins/UCD, Splunk monitoring.
- GNR Health Care: data engineering for claims and billing; ETL with Python/SQL; KPI dashboards; HIPAA-aware workflows and reporting automation.

### Core Skills
Java, Spring Boot, Microservices, REST, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift, GCP, AWS, Terraform, Jenkins, Artifactory, MongoDB, Oracle, SQL, Splunk, BDD (Cucumber/Gherkin).
